intro: Ardisia pyrsocoma, commonly known as the red-fruited beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. Following the flowers, it produces bright red, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Ardisia pyrsocoma is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
